reviews.review_pros: Great place to work for, amazing people to work with. Team work is such an important aspect in delivery of outstanding customer service
reviews.review_cons: so far, I have not experienced any negativity
reviews.review_advice: just a matter of standardization of training materials

reviews.review_pros:
If you are looking for a company with competitive wages, great benefits, and a absolutely unbeatable team of individuals as your coworkers, A&A is the place to be. more than that, A&A practices its principles through it's core values. One key principles is to learn and grow. And no where else is this more true than here. Here you can develop your skillset and advance yourself as an employee and as a person. How far you wish to grow is up to you.
On a personal note, A&A provided me the flexibility that allowed me to meet an exceed my own personal goals. Working remotely, I was able to relocate across the country, increase my standard of living drastically, and open up opportunities that were never available to me before. Far and few employers will do that for their employees.
A&A is truly amazing as a company and more so the people within it. It is simply the place to be.
reviews.review_cons: Winters are colder in WV than WA. I'm learning that now.
reviews.review_advice: Always strive to make the job and the border free of obstacles, for the client and the employees!

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello, thank you for this review, and for including one of our Core Values in the title! (Make It Happen)
I love how you've walked through some of our core values in your review, as this means they are not simply hanging on the wall, but have come alive inside of A & A. That is so wonderful to see.
It makes me really happy to see that you've moved across the country, relocated to a new home, and are thriving!
We polled our people every quarter during the pandemic to find out your preferences for working from home, and each time over 80% of our people chose they would rather work from home. 
This led us to the decision to cancel coming back to the office until at least September 2022. We've seen multiple people move to new homes, new locations that better suit their lifestyle, and we love to see this. 
We've also polled our people on compensation & benefits and while we know that we can always do better, we've made improvements over the last year and have more in store in the planning stages. 
Thanks again!
GB

reviews.review_pros: This has by far been my favorite place to work--and working from home to boot. My coworkers are helpful, kind, and easy to reach. My managers are knowledgeable as well as helpful and they provided me with all the tools I need for success. And the pay is the icing on the cake.
reviews.review_cons: Make sure your internet speed is up to par.
reviews.review_advice: Keep being amazing at what you are doing!

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello and thank you for this review!
I'm so happy to hear that this has been your favorite place to work by far - and that you are loving working from home!
When we decided to stay home until at least September 2022, we didn't make that decision lightly - we surveyed our team every quarter to see what was on their mind, and over 80% of our people wanted to continue to work from home. We're proud that this decision positively impacts our people. There have been so many openings, closings, mandates, children not vaccinated yet, etc., etc., and we're hoping by September 2022 we can take another look and things will look a lot more settled by then. 
As always, we will survey our team and see what you prefer.
Love to hear that your managers are knowledgeable & helpful. As the saying goes "People don't leave a company, they leave their Manager." so it's important that we have great management to keep our people engaged and learning & growing.
It's rare to hear that people are happy with pay, and we've really put our money where our mouth is - we implemented a $20 minimum wage in the USA & Canada so that nobody at our company will ever make less than $20 per hour, and we did a cost of living increase company-wide earlier this year - thank you for mentioning that it's icing on the cake - we are proud of the work we have done, and still have more work to do to be even better!
Thanks again,
GB

reviews.review_pros: Lots of great reasons to work here. Everything is amazing. All if the stuff clock in and do their work. When it is time to leave they clock out. Flexibility with schedule, breaks. Very supportive of working from home during COVID and in the near term. Some great employees who are eager to see it grow. Very customer centric and want to grow.
reviews.review_cons: Not enough resources and out dated systems bring inefficiencies.
reviews.review_summary: Nice Workplace and some great staff

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello and thank you for your review!
I'm so glad to hear you think there are lots of great reasons to work here. 
Everything is amazing! That's also awesome to hear, but we also know that there's a lot more we can do, and we set high priority goals each quarter and going after them to make us better and better. 
I also love hearing that people clock in, do their work, and clock out. That's all we expect! We really believe that you shouldn't be a slave to your work, and that you should have great energy at work - we expect your best when you're here - and then when you're done - log off, go for a walk, a nap, be with your family, your friends, your dog, whatever - and don't worry about the office. Don't look at or answer emails or Slack after hours or on weekends - we got you! Turn off, enjoy! 
And that attitude flows over to COVID when we knew we just wanted to worry about our people, their families, and our customers. We know that if our people are good, our customers will be good. 
That's why we continue to work from home, and are staying there until at least September 2022.  So many other things going on like summer break, back to school, etc., etc. - let's let this thing run its course and reassess next year.
Yes, we are absolutely customer-centric - wanting to make the border disappear for our customers so they can grow their business, in turn growing ours.
With regards to resources - yes we are on a hiring spree right now with a bunch of open positions as we are growing and want to keep pace with demand. Our systems have steadily been upgraded - new phone system (virtual), new email system, and we are working on our customs system next.
Thanks again for your review, I appreciate it.
GB

reviews.review_pros:
True team environment
Approachable and engaged executive group
Agile workforce focused on learning and growing
reviews.review_cons:
Big goals sometimes over-shadow the operational focus 
Multiple ongoing process improvements 
Turnover resulting in lost expertise and training gaps
reviews.review_advice:
Stay committed to the process
Lean into the success of the work-groups who are out-preforming their goals.
Be impeccable with your word; if compensation , improvement or support is promised see-to-it that it is delivered

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello and thank you for your review!
The Pros you've outlined are so great to hear - that we have a true team environment - one of our core values is Play As A Team, and so knowing that you see this alive in our company is fantastic. I also love hearing that you find our leadership team approachable and engaged - we always want to have safety and trust in our team.

Yes, we have big goals, we work hard at achieving them each quarter, and we're always trying to get better. Our turnover is less than 2% which we are really proud of, but we know that if even 1 person leaves it can create a gap sometimes.

Thank you for your advice. We are committed to the process, and we are working on better identifying and rewarding high performers. With regards to compensation, we are super happy to have announced company-wide raises again this year, as well as implementing a $20.00 minimum wage across the entire company in both countries - the USA and Canada. Nobody at A & A will ever make less than $20 per hour - USD or CAD. Those are promises that we set out to implement and we've delivered on them. 

We have so much more to do to keep getting better and better, and it's people like you who genuinely want A & A to be the best that will help get us there!

Thank you,
GB

reviews.review_pros: As a new hire I received a very intimate and hands on course learning about A&A's company structure and culture that was very exciting and inspiring. Many companies talk culture but A&A walks the walk. Very attentive and passionate leadership team!
reviews.review_cons: I'm a little over a month in an no cons to report so far.

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hi and thank you so much for this review!

I'm so happy to hear that your onboarding process was fantastic.  
We have a belief about hiring and retaining A Players, taken from the great Keith Cunningham:

Number one, interview rigorously.  (Our interview process could be considered to be  a bit long, but we want to make sure we're a right fit for each other.)
Number two, compensate generously. (We recently launched our $20 Minimum Wage - everyone at A & A whether in the USA or Canada makes $20 or more per hour in their local currency. We also did a cost of living increase and are adding better benefits)
Number three, onboard effectively.  (This is your point - we are doing more and more with our onboarding to make sure you're ready to rock!)
Number four, measure consistently. (We have weekly and monthly KPI's so we all know what winning looks like)
Number five coach continuously. (We do 1 on 1's to make sure we're continuously improving)

So, hearing your feedback is reinforcing that we are doing the right things.
Thanks again, and welcome to A & A!
GB

reviews.review_pros: None, working here was the biggest mistake of my life.
reviews.review_cons: Low pay, horrible work environment. Definetly do not apply here!
reviews.review_summary: Stay far away from this place!!
reviews.review_advice: You'll be out of business in six months.

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello,
This review seems that it has come from someone who didn't actually work at A & A. 

The reason we think this is because it's saying that the person worked with us for less than a year in our Blaine office, but we haven't had anyone leave on bad terms in our Blaine office who worked for us less than a year.

And it's way out of character from most of our reviews.

However, if it is from someone who worked at A & A, we are glad you are in a better place now, and we sincerely wish you the best!

We consistently hire people at a higher rate of pay than the company they come from (It's our goal to have a $20 minimum wage in the next year or so), so we don't believe we have low pay.

We've also been working from home since March 2020, and plan to say there until at least early 2021, so the work environment is probably a bit isolating if you're by yourself. We have been a Certified Great Place to Work as of October 2019 in the USA, and 83% of our people said we were a great place to work.  Google search "certified great place to work A & A Customs Brokers" to read more.

We were founded in 1979 and we celebrated our 40th year in business in 2019, so we're certain we won't be out of business in 6 months. :-)  In fact, we just closed out September 2020 and both our USA and Canadian operations showed nice growth.

Again, we don't believe this was someone from A & A, and if it was, we sincerely wish you the best in your new chapter!
GB

reviews.review_pros: Working at A&A has been a great experience. The opportunity to learn something new everyday is endless.  At A&A you advance as much as you want,  with hard work  and motivation. I, personally started at the bottom and worked my way up to a new shift in less than a year.  The CEO and other executives give you a chance to speak openly about any questions or concerns. We have all the tools and resources we need to efficiently and successfully complete any task given to us.  Management does an awesome job helping us tackle our goals. Our office environment is  unbelievable, everyone makes you feel like family.  I am pleased to say that this is the company I work for. #servewithenthusiasm
reviews.review_cons: Parking lot is very small and can sometimes be challenging to get in and out of.  Also, the billing system is outdated and flustering to navigate.
reviews.review_advice: Management always makes it a point to say how much they appreciate everyone. They are the ones behind the scenes making it all happen. We wouldn't be the team we are without each of them.

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hey I love that you hashtagged in one of our core values #servewithenthusiasm!

Thank you so much for this review, it's nice to see that as a newer member of the team, you're off to a great start and feeling about A & A.

I've heard that the parking lot is an issue a few times recently, we'll have to see what we can do about this! It's partly an issue because we're growing and hiring more and more great people! :-)  

Thank you,
GB

reviews.review_pros:
1. Company Culture - A & A has a clearly defined purpose and strong values that guide the company and all of its employees. This starts from the top down and is displayed in each interaction with every customer and every colleague. 

2. Executive Team & Radical Transparency - The company operates off of a proven model that is radically transparent and allows for collaboration, accountability, innovation and growth. You are encouraged to bring your ideas to the table and empowered to do so. You are encouraged to share your professional goals and what you would like to work towards attaining and you can expect for that to not only be discussed but explored.

3. The company has your "back" - Within my first month I had a family member fall extremely sick and the situation worsened. This was worrisome to me as a brand new employee. From the COO to my Director and HR Manager I was fully supported. I was able to take time off if I wanted to and was even encouraged to do so. I was offered bereavement leave and a multitude of other supportive options. Life happens and knowing that you are seen as a person and not just an employee is empowering. 

4. Technology - A & A has enabled fully remote work and the technology available to all remote employees is something the company is continually investing in. This is a focal point for the company and will continue to add value to a healthy work / life balance. 

5. Your Team - There is such an amazing group of diverse individuals that you are able to call your colleagues . From different backgrounds and cultures and with different personal and professional experiences. People genuinely do care for one another and it is displayed on a daily basis.
reviews.review_cons: There are no cons at this time. The industry as a whole seems to be a bit technologically outdated however I feel we are constantly working to change that.
reviews.review_summary: Your Career at A & A - A collective growth mindset providing endless opportunities

reviews.review_pros: The energy of Company is lively and that was huge for me. Positive work environment and teams who appreciated each other was what I needed. Also being offered to work from home was great, as I get to do what I love and work for a company across the country. I was welcomed on day one like I have been with the company for many years. My first impression was that they needed me, valued me and wanted to utilize all my strengths to help coach others. The learning opportunities are endless. Many different cultures and backgrounds that work at A & A which makes the company a more diversified place to work!
reviews.review_cons: The team is looking for more great people so we can support each other more with our day to day tasks.
reviews.review_summary: Upbeat, Energetic Company who loves to Learn and Grow as one Team

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello and thank you for this 5-star review!
It makes me happy to hear that you are feeling positive energy here. It's been a lot of hard work to bring on people that lift each other up, have personal accountability for making their life better, and it's paying off with the energetic people we are attracting! 
It's also great to hear that you feel welcome and connected to the team considering you are remote, working from home. When we decided to stay home until at least September 2022, we knew we had to shift our culture to be a better remote-first company, and while we aren't perfect, we are working on getting better and better for our teammates.  
Thanks again for this review!
GB

reviews.review_pros: The staff at A&A are very supportive and helpful.
reviews.review_cons: Too many tasks are being handled by a single person.
reviews.review_summary: A & A is a great place to work

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello and thank you for leaving this review.
Our purpose is "We Thrive On Helping People" so hearing that our people are very supportive and helpful is wonderful!
Very interesting that you say that too many tasks are being handled by a single person. One of our ROCKS (Goals) this year will be to move away from 'multi-tasking' to more 'single-tasking' so our people can do more deep work with less interruptions. Great to hear we are aligned on this!
Thanks again for your review!
GB

reviews.review_pros:
1. The #1 reason anyone stays at a job is their teammates. Our team can't be beaten. Everyone here truly cares about each other
2. The #1 reason anyone has a job is to support their lifestyle. At A & A, we have instituted a minimum $20/hour wage. This means anyone who joins us will start at $20/hour. Salaries go up from here - we are competitive, and are looking to continuously improve
3. A & A's core values - SMPL- Serve with Enthusiasm, Make It Happen, Play As A Team, Learn & Grow are not just words on a wall. We show up for each other, our customers, and the business!
4. We don't want to be like anyone else - we want to be simply better and are committed to continuous improvement
5. Benefits- Everyone gets the standard health, dental, medical. However, A & A has some unique benefits such as:
 -Honeymoon High 5- 5 days of paid vacation to go on your honeymoon
- Parental Leave- a min of 4 month paid on both sides of the border
-Remote Work- We just want the best talent. Why does anyone need to be chained to an office? We trust and empower our staff
-Bereavement- 2 weeks. 3 days is just not enough for anyone. 
-Flexibility- You are never treated like a # - we will work with anyone to ensure work/life/self balance
reviews.review_cons:
1. We are not perfect - we are learning every day
2. Our systems and processes are not fully dialled in and we know it. So we are actively fixing this
3. Change- we embrace it. We are always looking to improve. It is not flavour of the month. It is strategic, fast paced, value add work. We work like a start up!
reviews.review_summary: The Good, Bad, and Ugly from the COO- Full Transparency

review_employer_responses.response_text: Thanks for this review, Daisy! :-)

reviews.review_pros:
- The company provides regular transparent communication (weekly huddles, CEO weekly updates, 1-on-1's with Manager) to share information and seek actionable feedback - Leadership has had a big push listening to feedback and actioning it.

-They took decisive action at the beginning of COVID-19 to provide the option to staff to work remotely from home for the safety of all staff and their families. 
Amazing job!

- A & A has an amazing benefit for new fathers where they will get 4 months of fully paid time off to support the family and be there to watch the baby grow. This allows the om to take the full Maternity Leave. Talk about family!

- A & A is a company that truly lives its core values and uses them to make decisions on how we move forward with people, clients, projects, etc.
reviews.review_cons: - None that I can think of.
reviews.review_summary: Feels like a family. Amazing place to work!
reviews.review_advice:
- Keep pushing the goalposts further, and challenge staff to perform to their max abilities.
- Keep making decisions based on our core values and value proposition.

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello and thank you for this great review!
I love to hear that you're happy about the transparency. We want to be sure our people know what's happening - everything from the great to the brutal facts.
We're happy to hear that our actions during COVID were appreciated, as we wanted to relieve our people of having to wonder about getting sick, infecting their families, etc. We just wanted to remove that from your plate. At the same time, we know that the only reason we were able to transition successfully is due to all the teamwork and #makeithappen spirit of our wonderful people!

I'm also glad to hear that you appreciate our parental leave. We rolled that out in 2017 as part of a wider compassionate leave announcement to make sure we are offering the best compassionate leave possible.  More details here:

Parental leave:
Four months of paid time off for new moms and dads for childbirth and adoption

Bereavement leave:
20 days of paid leave to grieve an immediate family member
10 days of paid leave to grieve an extended family member

Family sick time:
6 weeks of paid leave within a 12 month period to be with a family member with a long term illness
3 days to take care of a family member with a short term illness

I'm also really happy to see you referencing our core values so much - it means that they are coming alive within the company and not just words on a wall. Thank you!

reviews.review_pros:
* We are super proud to announce our $20 Minimum Wage - everyone here now makes at least $20 per hour, and we'd like to get that even higher.
* We have just done a Cost of Living wage increase company-wide.
* We are doing a full benefits review to make sure our benefits are actually benefits! And we did a survey to see what our people care the most about so we can make sure we are improving in the right areas.
* We are still fully remote as a company, we have surveyed our people and over 80% want some sort of work from home, and we are also allowing people to work in the office who would like to do that.
* We have weekly and monthly KPI's so we know where we are winning and where we need to improve.
* Everyone in the company knows our Vision and Goals on a Quarterly basis.
* We use modern software systems like Slack, Google Workspace, Voice Over IP phones (Softphone)
* We get to deal with amazing customers importing and exporting really interesting products - from the food you eat to the clothes you wear to helicopters, Ferrari's, and even horses and dogs!
* Our core Values are SMPL - Serve With Enthusiasm, Make It Happen, Play As A Team, Learn & Grow - and those are characteristics that we are looking for in YOU.
reviews.review_cons:
* If fully remote / WFH is not for you, you may not like working at A & A.
* There is a lot of autonomy here - and we expect you to solve problems, and that's not for everyone. There's a saying from the great Ray Dalio "Speak Up, Own It, or Get Out" - meaning "you not only have the privilege to speak up and “fight for right” but are obliged to do so."
* If you don't like change, you will be uncomfortable here.
* We promote learning and growth and if you don't like to read books, articles, and constantly improve, you won't like it here.
* If you want to just be left alone and not question the way things are done, you will be uncomfortable here.
reviews.review_summary: Update from the CEO (I'm allowed to do 1 Yearly Review on Glassdoor - Full Transparency)
reviews.review_advice:
Full Transparency - CEO's and Management and others are allowed to leave 1 review on Glassdoor per year (one every 12 months), and here is where I do a company update as our Year End comes to a close.
Our Year End is August 31st and we set some fun goals for this year and as we close out the year - we want to keep growing, we've added some more team members to accelerate that growth, and we're always looking for happy, energetic, positive people that want to join our team!

Connect with me anytime on Linked In - Graham Robins

review_employer_responses.response_text: I like to respond to all reviews personally, but this one is from me, so no response is required. :-)  GB

reviews.review_pros:
- Company provides regular communication (weekly huddles, CEO weekly updates, 1-on-1's with COO) to share information and to seek actionable feedback
- Leadership listens to feedback and actions it quickly. A recent example is from our most recent eNPS survey. Leadership awarded COLA increases within 2 weeks & the company also instituted a $20 minimum wage across the board - even though this is quite a bit higher than the provincial or state minimums, and compared to our competitors!!
- The company understands and respects work/life balance. When the Covid-19 pandemic hit, even before the lockdown, they moved to a work-from-home model within days to keep employees and their families safe and we are still using this model today. The leadership team continually checks in with us to understand how we feel about a potential return to the office once all restrictions are lifted. 
- The company and its employees live their values - they are not just words on a wall. Employees are encouraged to continuously learn and grow through courses and industry events. Information learned at these sessions is shared with team members so we can all benefit. Team members help each other & our customers.
- As we grow across Canada and the USA, I have been fortunate enough to be part of revamping our onboarding process to help set new employees up for success from Day 1.
reviews.review_cons: - While we grow in this post-Covid world, there are some things that are evolving such as new processes, policies, and updating systems/technology. Luckily, the team continues to focus on its employees and customers & what is working well and going right instead of getting hung up on what is wrong. #learnandgrow
reviews.review_summary: Great Place to Work with Supportive Leadership
reviews.review_advice: Continue sharing information and being open to feedback as you have been this year.

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello and thank you for this review!
At A & A we're always trying to get better for our people and for our customers, and so seeing this review with all these points of the things we are trying to do to constantly improve is really gratifying! 

At Amazon, there's a saying that I really like - "It's always Day 1" - and this means we're just getting started, we have a lot more work to do, and a lot more we can do to be even better. We know this. 

One of the things we've really enjoyed over the last year is getting a lot of employee feedback via surveys on everything from work from home preferences to how we should improve our benefits, and then taking all of those ideas and having fun doing what our people want! 

We know the success of our company and the happiness of our customers relies on great people and we know we've got the best people - thank you!
GB

reviews.review_pros: The people (co-workers), were great!
reviews.review_cons: Ever changing before you even completed/implemented the previous changes

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello and thank you for your review.
Thank you for the 10+ years you were at A & A, and I'm glad to hear you thought your co-workers were great and for you to spend a decade with us really says something about our people and our culture!

Yes, A & A is constantly changing, constantly improving, and we know that isn't for everyone. People who want to throw out the old way of doing things will thrive at A & A, and if we have someone who doesn't want to change, doesn't want to improve or get better - A & A can be a frustrating place. 

We once heard a competitor say to us "I wish you would stop doing things over there!"  

And we want to keep that spirit alive, keep changing - before you get changed - keep improving. We believe customers are constantly dissatisfied and therefore our role is to constantly change, adapt, improve and keep ahead of that dissatisfaction.  

We wish you all the best in your future endeavors!
GB

reviews.review_pros:
I have been a Customs Broker for 19 years and have worked for 3 different Customs brokers. A & A is one of the best Customs Broker I have worked for. 
Since starting at A & A in 2015 my experience working here has been amazing. The friendly and knowledgeable staff are always willing to help, and the upper management is always supportive, whether it's work related or personal. The culture here is what makes the company, we all believe that what we do makes a difference. Everyday we strive to work as a team, learn new things, and always make it happen! 
Our focus is to always provide customers with a seamless experience. 
Since COVID-19 our company has given the option to staff to work remotely from home for the safety of all staff and their families. 
A & A also offers many amazing benefits for their staff, one of which I got to recently use. Being a new father, A & A graciously gives 4 months off with compensation so that you can be there with your family and take care of your new baby. Having this opportunity given to me makes me appreciate and value this company and how much they care for families and their wellbeing.
reviews.review_cons: Outdated system but improvements are coming. Communication, however we are always improving with meetings and coaching.
reviews.review_summary: Great place to work with great benefits!!
reviews.review_advice: Valuable input from team members, one-on-ones are essential for development and improvements.

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello and thank you so much for your review!
I'm happy to hear that we have an experienced customs broker at A & A who finds us one of the best to work for. That's what we are striving for, to be a best place to work. We were certified Great Place to Work in Canada and USA last year and hope to do it again! I'm glad you feel a strong sense of culture - being remote for almost a year now has had us concerned about how to keep the A & A culture alive and well, and hearing that you're still feeling that it's strong is so great to hear.  It's so great to hear that you are taking advantage of some of our extraordinary benefits! We really want to stand out and step up with our support for our people. When we rolled these out in 2017, we wanted to have a well rounded approach to supporting not just our people but also their family and extended family. These are some of the highlights below:
Parental leave
Four months of paid time off for new moms and dads for childbirth and adoption
Bereavement leave
20 days of paid leave to grieve an immediate family member
10 days of paid leave to grieve an extended family member
Family sick time
6 weeks of paid leave within a 12 month period to be with a family member with a long term illness
3 days to take care of a family member with a short term illness

Yes, we are constantly looking at better systems and processes and glad you can see that they have been implemented or are coming soon. Regarding communication - I'm sure we can always do better here, and please talk to your manager about how we can be better in this area.

Lastly, our Quarterly Town Halls and Weekly All Hands meetings are a great way to hear from our team, keep the ideas coming! 
Thank you and congratulations on being a new father!
GB

reviews.review_pros: I get to work at home
reviews.review_cons: Having to wonder which of the personalities you will get from the COO. Having to make and wear a Dunce Cap while in a meeting with my peer group at the direction of the COO.
reviews.review_summary: Senior Management using fear and intimidation during COVID
reviews.review_advice: Maybe come out from behind Slack and see what is really happing in your business  Graham

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello, thank you for this review.
I (GB/Graham) respond to every review that is posted and I have to say this seems like a review that wasn't posted by an employee at A & A.
One thing is that we don't have a role in our company called CSA - Customer Service Associated, so that's one point.
Secondly, "Having to make and wear a Dunce Cap.." - I googled that and found images of a Dunce Cap and talked to our COO - and that never happened - nobody made anyone make and wear a "Dunce Cap".
I have stepped back a bit over the last quarter, to make sure our leaders are developing and are empowered to run the business, serving our customers, and keep our employees happy and focused on our purpose of making the border disappear for our customers. While I love Slack, I also communicate via video once per week, we do monthly and quarterly updates, and I love all the feedback we get from our people.
GB

reviews.review_pros: CoWorkers, Some Benefits, Can be Flexible
reviews.review_cons: Owner, Director & other Executive Level Management
reviews.review_advice:
I won't leave 'advise for management' as they truly don't care what anyone who actually does the day to day work has to say. 
The owner only wants "yes men" around him & the staff suffer for it.
They tout they everyone is like "family"; which is true among the workers but not among Owner/Executives.  They once were a great company; now they are terrible in so many ways. 
I am sure the Owner will have some big response about how wrong the negative review is, as he always does, but it's just to make himself feel better, and keep up the facade they try to portray to new hires.  It's nothing more than a smoke &  mirror show... Don't be fooled!
Use this company as a stop over on your journey; don't make it a career, get in & get out - loyalty is a one way street to them; they will not return it.

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello and thank you for the review.
This one hurts a bit and I can understand you being frustrated with us.
Due to COVID we had to make some people changes and that is the worst thing that can happen to an employee.  When the borders closed in March and trade dropped by 30%, we had to make some decisions that unfortunately impacted our people. 
On the positive side, I'm glad to hear that the Pros are great coworkers, benefits, and our flexibility which are things we are proud of. Currently, we are all working from home still and hope to stay that way for a while.
I would disagree that we don't care what our people have to say - we encourage feedback and we hold monthly meetings, quarterly updates (all hands) and put a lot of time & effort into answering questions, asking questions, and learning how we can be better. One of our core values is #learnandgrow. 
I don't feel like I have "yes men" (or women) around me - in fact, most of our battles are because we DON'T agree and we love debating until we find what's best for our customers and our people. 
I do not use the word "family" to describe our culture or business. In fact, I don't really like the word to describe a company - I prefer "Team" like a sports team - another core value is #playasateam.  We are not a family, we are a team and sometimes, unfortunately, some players have to get traded or retired and that's something you can't do as a family. We are a team and are looking for great players in every position.
If you look at my previous responses to Reviews, I don't believe I usually say how wrong the negative review is. I like to address each issue, point by point, to let you know our position on that issue. You will have your opinion and we/I will have mine. 
We had a very difficult 2020, and I can see you were impacted by that which I feel terrible for. The decisions we made in 2020 have led us to have a great start to 2021, the borders are currently stable, our business is growing, and we have a bright outlook. 
Thank you,
GB

The technology is being updated and that would make working smarter much easier.

reviews.review_pros: I have worked with A&A for many many years. I have always found the company to value the input of staff and provide ample opportunity to learn and grow. A&A supports staff to keep up to date with knowledge in regards to classes and courses and involvement in a variety of associations.  Opinions are valued and appreciated.  In my opinion there is nothing better than working as a team in obtaining common goals, serving our clients and staff with enthusiasm,making it happen and continuing to learn and grow. review_employer_responses.response_text:

reviews.review_pros:
I have been with the company for almost two years now and I have to say this is one of the few companies out there that care and truly listen to their employees. I started out a receptionist when I started and I was able to move up from my position in no time which is amazing considering that I came in not knowing a single thing about the customs broker industry.
Here are a few more other reasons and opportunities that this company is unique and special:
-Very involved in our community and they offer staff a lot of volunteer opportunities to participate in
-They celebrate the accomplishments and special events of employees like birthdays, work anniversaries and more
-They have such great values and tight-knit connection with everyone they work with, we honestly feel like a big family.
-They make you feel welcome the moment that you walk in through the doors
-They are very transparent with the inner workings of the company and update us quarterly on how well the company is going and the future plans
-They are always there to lean a hand, everyone one is so eager and happy to help each other to achieve the same goal.
-The work that we do is interesting and ever-evolving which makes it such an interesting career to learn and grow in.
-The benefits that are offered are truly geared to the needs we may medically encounter
- They always try to involve employees ' family which is something that a lot of other companies don't offer
-Offer ongoing training in the business if you want to advance your career
-Very flexible with hours and scheduling 
- Very diverse and multi-cultural
 - Meeting with your manager once a month to discuss your progress and be truly honest in your review
-L10 meeting (They help discuss the issues of the week and how we can solve them moving forward)
- They allow you to be honest about the issues in the company and work together to find solutions 
- They keep up with industry changes and try to find new ways to make it easier for our clients.

Overall this is an outstanding place to work and inspiring culture to be a part of.
reviews.review_cons:
No one can be perfect so here are a few things the company can improve on:

- Better training for completely new staff in customs ( if you are not putting in your own effort to learn you will not be shown) and the training is very interrupted since they have to train you on the job.

- It is hard to meet with a manger outside of the normal meeting scheduled

- Learning a lot about how to work with new technologies and how to work with them in our industry ( hard for people not tech savy)

-Our company is open 24/7 so they work is continuous and never-ending
reviews.review_summary: Why A&A is the best to Work
reviews.review_advice: My only advice to management would be to make sure to check in with your employees from time to time especially if they are doing an amazing job because sometimes it is intimating to ask for a raise and if you see they deserve one it is nice to be recognized in that way.

review_employer_responses.response_text:

Having just received our Great Place To Work Certification for the first time, it's super gratifying to have people like you who appreciate our culture and all the work we are putting into becoming a Great Place To Work!

We are also really aligned with your suggestions to improve and these items are on our Issues List to solve.

Thanks again, I really appreciate the detail you've provided!
GB

reviews.review_pros: A&A is a company where what people do matters and  they take care of each other. reviews.review_pros: The front line staff are amazing people but sadly get mistreated by managers and executives who view them as disposable.
reviews.review_cons:
Where should I start... Avoid this company AT ALL COSTS!!

1) The CEO is a privileged man who doesn't have a clue how to run a business, and refuses to listen to the people under him who actually do the jobs. Instead, he hires a bunch of executive staff with egos as big as his (who have ZERO industry experience) who will simply do whatever he wants. He got rid of truly talented team players that worked hard, who embodied the so called "company culture" and were helping to try and improve the company every time executive staff broke another piece of it.
2) The executive staff has had all the negative reviews REMOVED from social media and recruitment platforms. This proves the unwillingness to except that A & A is NOT a great place to work and that A & A does not treat their staff right. But don't worry job hunters, I'm here to correct that for you now!
3) They pay BELOW industry standards, do NOT give any raises unless you go above and beyond (meaning work yourself to death, take courses and prove you can utilize these new skills. But you'll have a probationary period and if they don't think you're ready yet, bye bye raise!) and if you make to much, they'll cut you loose. And if that doesn't deter you, then remember when you're struggling to pay your bills, that the Executives who boss you around yet don't even understand the industry are making 3 to 4 times what you are. 
4) They work the front line staff to their breaking point. The turnover rate at A & A is ridiculous! I'm talking 60 people in 1 year... in a company of less than 100! They have hired over 50 people in a year and only approximately 10% are still there. The departments are ALL understaffed because they cannot hire and train fast enough to replace those who leave. Staff have gotten pushed so far past their breaking point they have walked out and just never came back. If you enjoy working unpaid overtime, not taking your unpaid lunch and working as fast as you possibly can, for it to never be enough, then hey, maybe A & A is perfect for you.
5) They preach growth, yet put up roadblock after roadblock. Oh, and you might get hired for a certain role, but don't get to attached, because they will decide to put you somewhere else at the drop of a hat.
6) You cannot speak your mind. They preached candor and say they will not have any repercussions for speaking your mind, and yet.... I can think of many employees who have been let go, fired or basically threatened out the door for advocating for the staff or the integrity of the company. 
7) Service failure after service failure from the Executive team not understanding the time sensitive nature of the industry. They think nothing about pulling an entire department away for a 90 minute meeting. But then they'll blame it on the employees when customers get upset. 

I could go on and on, but I'm hoping you get the gist of it by now. Oh, and Graham, I wouldn't bother responding to this review, the people who have/do work for you know the truth of what it's like to work at A & A. Those that you somehow manage to hire, will find out on their own what A & A is like pretty darn quick!
reviews.review_summary: The worst company to work for... EVER!
reviews.review_advice: Wouldn't matter if I left advice, they wouldn't take it. So instead I'll leave my advice for all job seekers considering A & A as their new place of work. Keep looking; you deserve better.

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello, and thank you for this review.

When a company is in an industry that has been slow to change and is moving away from doing things the way they’ve always been done, there is going to be some discomfort. 
I’m glad to hear that you think that the front line people are amazing - I agree! A & A is spending a lot of time and effort getting the right people who demonstrate our core values on our team and to see those efforts are being recognized is very gratifying. After all, a great workplace is amazing co-workers!

Yes, I do consider myself privileged - to be able to work with such a great group of people who are constantly learning and growing.

I’m not perfect, but I think we’re doing very well - we have 23 employees that have been with us for more than 10 years, and 12 that have been with us for more than 20 years! We celebrate 40 years in business this year, and our top customers send us referral letters and testimonials all the time. 

I/we like to hire people without industry experience because they offer a fresh/new/different perspective that challenges us and pushes us into different thinking. After all, we have amazing people who are certified customs brokers and we use their brains and expertise when it comes to the technical aspects of our business.

We can’t remove negative reviews from Glassdoor. If you google ‘I'm an employer. What can I do about negative reviews on Glassdoor?’ - they show that you can’t do anything about that, so the idea that we can remove negative reviews is not true. You also can’t delete or remove negative reviews on Google, etc. However, if there is a dispute and we resolve the issue with a customer, the customer can go back and edit their review if they are satisfied. As you’ve said, we believe in radical candor and we look forward to talking about any reviews we get - good or bad.

I don’t agree that we pay below industry standards. There are 300 customs broker companies in Canada and thousands in the USA, including 5-10 competitors right across the parking lot from us in Canada and the USA. If we paid below industry standards, there would be an exodus to our competitors. In fact, we’ve given dozens of raises over the past year, and, yes, we give them to people who live and demonstrate our core values. One of the worst things a company can do is pay poor performers the same as high performers. This is not fair to high performers. 

Regarding turnover, yes we’ve had some turnover. We track desired vs undesired turnover, and our undesired turnover is extremely low. If people demonstrate our core values and are a pleasure to be around, they will excel at A & A. The numbers you are stating are not correct - if we hired 50 people and only 10% stayed - that would mean that only 5 people stayed and 45 turned over. This is not true. And I don’t know of anyone that has ‘walked out and just never came back’. On the contrary, we’ve had a number of people who have asked to come back to A & A after pursuing other opportunities. With regards to overtime - overtime is optional at A & A and we happily pay overtime if it is required. It’s against the law to not pay for overtime. If it feels like we’ve been hiring a lot lately - that’s because we have been - we know we’ve gotten busier, as well as people retiring, maternity leave, etc., and we want to make sure we have the people in place to be staffed appropriately. And please be sure to always take your lunch! At the Canadian office, we’ve created a nice lunchroom, new, large fridges, new microwaves, new tables, blender, egg cooker, toaster oven and more to make it a spot for you to enjoy your lunch. It’s also why we really bug you to never eat at your desk… Take a break, go for a walk, sit outside. Please don’t work through your lunch. 

Yes, we encourage our people to learn and grow, take educational courses, many or most of which we reimburse you for. Anyone who takes and passes the CCS (Certified Customs Specialist) course is awarded a raise for getting this designation. We also promote the reading of our book of the quarter and we bring in professors and authors to learn from so we can continuously improve.  

You can speak your mind at A & A - if you attend one of our monthly fireside chats or quarterly huddles, you will see people raising their hands and questioning and challenging things here and we love this feedback. We also survey our people after every fireside and quarterly update and the feedback and ratings continue to improve.

Of course, we make mistakes and we handle them with enthusiasm and making it right with the customer. I have an example of just last week where we made a mistake - but after it was done we received a GLOWING review from the customer and how A & A always builds confidence with them and they even included the word WOW in their email to us. We handle thousands of transactions per week - let’s say for round numbers if we handled 10,000 shipments per month and we did 99% of them correctly, we would still have 100 mistakes per month. Our error rate and complaints are something we track and it is currently less than 1% error rate, something our people should be proud of.

Yes, every person is in one 90 minute meeting per week where we can IDS - Identify, Discuss and Solve issues that come up. This is your chance to speak up and identify issues so we can solve them. At A & A, we believe that we can solve ANY issue. We can’t solve EVERY issue, though - so we have to prioritize, and chip away at issues. We find the happiest people at A & A are the people who really participate in their weekly meeting, speak up and stand up for their issues until they are solved. It’s an amazing feeling to be getting hundreds of items solved and improved every week. 

I love reading and responding to these reviews, and I will continue to personally respond to each one and not delegate it to someone else in the company - because I care deeply about our reputation, I care about learning how we can improve and while I don’t agree with everything you’ve said here, you are right about some things and I always learn from this feedback.  

I know our company isn’t for everybody, and it shouldn’t be for everybody. That annoys some people. It annoys the people that do not align with our core values. And that’s exactly what we want - we want a fun, encouraging, learning environment for people who live our core values. 

I’m glad you’ve found a new home and I hope you’re thriving in your new role.
GB

reviews.review_pros:
1) Very strong and focused executive team - The company is following a proven operating system that works great and has got the whole company running on the same page.

2) Stong culture - The conpany culture is rooted around caring, working hard and helping others. Its not just words on the wall, they live and breathe the values. And it is being followed by all from the top. Negative and toxic people are swiftly dealt with and addressed. 

3) Company cares about the people - If you are sick, have personal issues, family member thats sick or dying. Basically anything that requires you to miss work, you are supported 100% by your peers and the leadership team. 

4) Innovation and improvement is encouraged - Leadership is open and willing to try new things that can improve the business and the employee experience. 

5) Professional and personal development is encouraged.

6) Location - Its headquartered in Surrey so if you live that way, nothing beats the commute.
reviews.review_cons:
1) Customs brokerage isn't the most exciting industry.

2) Outdated brokerage system
reviews.review_advice:
Stay the course. You are not just head and shoulders above other companies
in your industry, but also most companies period.

Don't worry too much about aging staff. If you keep building a strong reputation,  skilled staff in the industry will gravitate to your company.

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello and thank you for this review!

Reading all of the Pro's you've listed makes me feel very proud of the hard work we've put in and how far we've come.  Especially about our culture and caring about our people. The number of times I've heard a horror story about a sick or ill family member and the person being scared of being fired for missing work is heartbreaking. We all have ups and downs and we expect support from the company in both the highs and lows!

The cons - well I like to think customs brokerage is exciting! Every iPhone or laptop or your shoes or socks or your Vega protein powder is imported and a customs broker is involved in every one of those imports. However, I get your point - we need to do more to make it exciting - and a modern customs brokerage software system could definitely help with that.

Thanks again for your review, I appreciate it.
GB

The management team is candid and will admit mistakes when they are caught which is great but makes some jobs confusing at first. You as an employee should have the love and drive for learning and always getting better to fit well here.

Another core value is Play As A Team and you're right, if the leadership team has made a mistake, we will own it, talk about it, learn from it, and move forward. We don't dwell on the past because we're not going backward - we're moving forward.

Thanks again for your review, we appreciate it.
GB

reviews.review_cons: Where to begin? Pay is definitely not competitive. Maybe for upper management, but otherwise, a no-go. Trying to get a raise is like pulling teeth and they do not do yearly salary reviews or increases. Operations is a mess and we are drowning in work. CEO is incompetent when it comes to running a company. He gets a few ideas from books he reads, people he talks to, podcasts, and his time at "Harvard" and then tries to apply them to the business. In theory this sounds great, but he tries to shove ideas down the companies'throat which in practice, dont apply. Seems like he doesn't fully understand or comprehend them but tries to make it work anyways. Every quarter is the same story: he gets a new idea, tries to make it stick, doesn't work, and the others are left cleaning up his mess. Also, most of these reviews here are posted by either people here less than a year, who have yet to get over their honeymoon period or either from people who HR had previously approached to post reviews which they can pretty much guess who wrote them, essentially nulling the "anonymous" aspect. Be aware as people are leaving in heaps as they know this place is a sinking ship.
reviews.review_summary: Stay Away, Seriously. Don't fall for their tricks
reviews.review_advice: Listen to your employees when we tell you things don't work and actually fix them. We are sick of hearing "we are working on it" or "we will work on it later as it isn't a priority right now." There is a reason why we come and tell you problems. Stop trying to introduce 10 new things while the systems and procedures we use right now don't even work properly. Otherwise, good people will leave like they have all year so far. Stop trying to take one step forward and 3 steps back. Also, our Directors, you are still young. Go out there and work for leaders who are actually competent and will help you grow in the right direction. Don't waste your time trying to turn this sinking ship around, especially with You-Know-Who leading the charge. You're going to end up burnt-out with nothing to show for it.

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello and thank you for your review!

A & A is definitely going through a state of change with our people right now. The reason for this is that our core values and culture are getting stronger, and stronger and stronger, and so the people who are not aligned with our core values and our culture are finding that they don’t want to be here and we are encouraging them to find a new home. And we know and hope these people will find a great fit in the future! While we don’t love that there is some turnover, we are getting better and better at hiring for our core values fit. 

Now, when we hire, we talk to people about our core values. We talk to them about Learn and Grow and that you will be expected to help the company set goals, you will be expected to help us achieve them. You will be expected to read books and learn and grow. And when you do those things, you will be rewarded financially, you will be rewarded with more responsibility. People who don’t help us do those things, they realize they are not a fit and we both know it’s time to move on.

I normally answer each specific point in these reviews, but the last 3-4 reviews have been pretty much the same theme, so I thought I would do a broader response to what’s happening inside A & A and why we are seeing some turnover now.

Here are the major changes that occurred with our company in 2014:

1) We started to share our Vision and Goals with the entire company.
2) We started to hire, promote, and terminate by our core values.
3) Every year we set new company goals
4) Every quarter we set new goals to reach those yearly company goals
5) And, in this last quarter, we asked every single person in the company to set a goal to help us reach our quarterly goals, which will help us reach our yearly goals.
We do the above EVERY. SINGLE. QUARTER.

For people that fit our core values - they LOVE this involvement and are thinking of great goals and then crushing them every quarter. They understand goal setting, they understand continuous improvement.

What are the results of this? We are growing. We are more profitable. We are bringing on new customers from larger competitors. We are promoting people. We are hiring. We are giving rewards and raises to people who are crushing their goals and living our culture and core values - and our culture is as strong as it’s ever been.

We still have a ways to go, we’re not perfect, we’re always learning.

Thank you!
GB

reviews.review_pros: The benefits , nothing else
reviews.review_cons: This company has down sized so much of the employees that everyday you go to work wondering if you still have a job to go to. The HR speaks about staff to supervisors in front of other staff. When they let staff go they don’t even allow them to say by to coworkers. Profit is always before employees
reviews.review_summary: Horrible wouldn’t recommend this place to friends or family.
reviews.review_advice: Get new management

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello and thank you for your review.

Although this is overall a negative experience that you had, I'm glad to hear the benefits were good!

I'd like to respond to each of your points.
Yes, we have fewer people today than we did say this time last year. The reason for this is that we always look very strategically at replacing any position to make sure that we are looking at it in a current and future state. In other words, if someone who has been with us for 5 or 10 years leaves, times have changed, technology has changed, and we don't just replace the position without taking a hard look at what we need today and what we will need in the future.

We haven't done any downsizing recently, and when we do unfortunately have to let some people go, we try to do that on the same day rather than having one go here, another go there, etc., because it can be disturbing to the rest of the company.

We always tell our Manager that our people should never be surprised that we've had to go in different directions because a great manager will have had multiple conversations with our people before deciding that we are no longer a fit for each other. So there should be no wondering if you will have a job to go to because you will have had multiple conversations with your manager. Parting ways with someone is the last thing we want to do - it's very difficult on the person leaving and on the people remaining. However, we hold our core values very steady and if someone is talked to multiple times about which core value(s) they are violating, and they do not learn and grow, they do not make it happen, then we are left with helping that person find a company where they can be successful. We are always happy to see someone who was not a fit at A & A go on to have a successful next chapter in their career. It may be difficult to believe, but we truly want to see that person go on to a better place and be happy.

You're right, we no longer allow people who have been let go to say goodbye to coworkers. I have to admit that I still struggle with this one. When I've had to let someone go myself, I used to let them go gather their things, go say goodbye to their friends, clean out their desk, etc., because I felt that was the civilized way to do it. However, we've been advised that this is not the healthiest way to do it...in one case a couple years ago, the person was still at their desk half an hour later. This can be very emotional for them and the people that remain. Now, if we have to make that difficult decision, we let them know it's best if they go now and we will gather their things and follow up. The good news is that we still care about these people and we've seen many instances where there are get-togethers, drinks, dinners, lunches, etc., with the people who have left and their friends at A & A. We appreciate seeing this. In a few cases recently,  senior management has also taken people out for lunch because one of our core values is Serve with Enthusiasm - and we mean that all the way through their experience with A & A.

Regarding profit before employees, we do agree that a company needs to be profitable first and foremost - otherwise the company and the people are in danger. However we feel that profit comes from happy, engaged employees. We spend a lot of effort on adding things to improve our people's lives. You can see some of our many benefits here: https://www.aacb.com/best-place-work/   As you said in the beginning, we have great benefits and we are only able to do that because we have the best people in the industry! We want to be the best place to work, we are not perfect, but we are always striving to be better. 

Thank you and best wishes on your next chapter!
GB

reviews.review_pros: Awesome coworkers... well... while they last anyway.
reviews.review_cons: Owner and leadership team doesn’t know what they are doing. They find ways to delete all negative reviews and it’s so unethical. Don’t work here...warning.
reviews.review_advice: Owner has no education and doesn’t know what he’s doing. Operations are drowning and we need help. I can’t wait to get out of here. Don’t come here...you will regret it!

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Hello and thank you for your review. 
We agree, we have many awesome people here! 

I feel our leadership team is doing a fantastic job! We're recruiting awesome people (as you've said), and we track our undesired turnover, which is people who we would not want to leave and who we would enthusiastically hire back, and that number is still 0 for the year. This means that anyone that has left our company in the last year has been a good decision for them and for us. And, we are achieving our goals and growing on both sides of the border which means our leadership team is effective at executing. 

Regarding deleting negative reviews - that's not true and it's also not possible for us to do that. In fact, Glassdoor has a procedure where an employer CAN flag a review to be removed if they think it's fraudulent, but we've never done that. We still do have negative reviews here - we know not everyone will always be happy with us. We did notice that some of our negative reviews were removed. When this happened, we asked Glassdoor about it to see what happened, and they let us know when or how they remove reviews but did not provide specifics. (See email chain from Glassdoor below.. *UPDATE OCT 22, 2018 - My response has been deleted twice from Glassdoor, by Glassdoor, because, I believe, I was including their email... So I will no longer include their email to avoid being deleted) 

Regarding me having no education - you're sort of right... :-) 
I've spent time at Kwantlen University, SFU Business School, UBC Sauder, Harvard Business School (twice) and London Business School. I'm a member of YPO which bills itself as "The premier leadership organization of chief executives in the world. YPO is the global platform for chief executives to engage, learn and grow. YPO members harness the knowledge, influence and trust of the world’s most influential and innovative business leaders to inspire business, personal, family and community impact. Today, YPO empowers more than 25,000 members in more than 130 countries, diversified among industries and types of businesses. Altogether, YPO member-run companies employ 16 million people and generate USD6 trillion in annual revenues." I also read Audiobooks and Podcasts on a weekly and sometimes daily basis. 
BUT, I have no degree, MBA or any other certification (Except I am a Licenced Customs Broker) - and if I look back on what I knew 5 years ago vs what I know today, I sure feel stupid 5 years ago! I would call myself a lifelong learner. Continuously trying to get better, never finished. 

Operations are drowning because we are growing and we've identified this as a goal for this quarter and we are hiring as fast as we can but also slow enough to get the right (awesome) people! We've hired about 10 people in Operations in the last 40 days and still have more work to do here. 
This is a good problem to have as a business - but we need to make sure we get the right resources so our people can make sure we deliver on our awesome customer service. 

I'm glad you've decided to find a new home and I hope you flourish wherever you land. You spend more time at work than you do with your family or friends and I'm a big believer that you should be extremely happy at work. Life is too short! 
Best wishes. 
GB

reviews.review_pros: At All American I found not just a job but a career. With the guidance of my manager and mentor Stephanie in the span of one year I have become an Account Manager and manage my own team. With the guidance of our CEO Paul and my manager Stephanie everyday I am pushed to be the better version of myself to my clients and staffers. My career with All American and my income are all in my control as you get what you get out what you out in. I look forward to learning and growing with this company for years to come!
reviews.review_cons: At times stressful but no more than any other career

reviews.review_pros: I provide staff to healthcare facilities across the country. My heart feels good knowing this alone, the money is just a plus (to me) and there is money to be made.  Being an Account Manager DEFINITELY has its benefits (not including health insurance which we have).  I never thought that I would have a career like this. Growing up, I’ve always known three things. I am different. I want to help people with whatever I do. I want to be a Doctor. However, when I was born, there was a plaque with my name that said “Future career- Business Management”. I always thought those kind of people were snobby and don’t know what it’s like and I’m going to be different. So, I went to school for Biology (Pre-Med). Almost finished, there is only 1 year of credits left but student loans have killed those chances. In 2016, after working MULTIPLE odd jobs,  and not finding a place that was energized enough in my opinion, I had enough. I decided it was time to go school again but another one without loans. So, I looked up and found a school that had a nursing program where I was. I figured this will get me back on track to being a Doctor. After finishing the entrance exam the Academic Advisor at the time called me in and went over the results. He asked me if I preferred “Healthcare Administration”(HA). I said “No, I want Nursing”.  He told me I would do better in that field but, again I refused. He then asked me to try a few courses first. Apparently it was really important I get into the HA program so I finally agreed. The first few courses were ok so I decided to stay plus I didn’t feel like changing and taking more courses so fate had a hand in this one. 2.3 years later And I had the degree but now what? I no longer wanted to be a Doctor at this point because going through school I also tried to be a CNA. I finished the 6 week course and even worked in a facility for a few shifts. However, fate came in again and for some reason I couldn’t pass the state test practical (I passed written). Luckily, the school set me up with a job at a Home Healthcare Company a month before finishing. It was the Administrative assistant position. I obviously took it without knowing full scope because it was a job right out of college; do you know how rare that is statistically?! Little did I know what the job entailed until my first day. I’m bombarded with scheduling the visits for the physical, occupational, and speech therapist (about 20 total). Contacting the nearby hospitals for Intake of new patients (around 75-100 at the time). HR duties including hiring paperwork, credentialing, and maintaining the JHACO certification for the company (we passed in 2019). Payroll duties such as making sure the therapists turn in their notes on time so I can approve the visit and bring the numbers and the payments from the patients insurance companies to our accountant.  I spent over a year doing this with one other person at any given time (they kept quitting), and loved it, why because that’s exactly the kind of job I wanted. I can never stay still so I needed a place that is constantly moving and I can help people.  The boss was, let’s just say hard to work with but she had a dream and I believed in her. She worked hard seeing the patients and I enjoyed when she came back to the office and told me the experience. I learned a lot from that place and I would probably still be there if it wasn’t for unforeseen circumstances. Two weeks later, I was working for All American. Almost the same thing but this time I have help. I thought I could do it all and I still can but, I don’t have to here. Furthermore, the sky is the limit here (bonuses) and we have a voice as to the future of this company. All American has taught me that you can go far alone but, even further with the right team.
reviews.review_cons: As for the cons, I warn anyone applying here. Yes we are busy, we move very fast (not fast enough in my opinion but I understand) and expect you to keep up. This is not the place for the kind of person who wants to be a librarian. Nothing wrong with it, you want a regular do the same thing everyday kind of job, by all means. This company for people who like to do a lot of different things at once. The ones who can’t sit still knowing that they have something to do because time is short. I would describe it as the “Pursuit of Happiness”. If you don’t like to grow and do better then this isn’t the place for you.  We are constantly growing and soon we will be in every state in the US. I look forward to that day and remember where we came from because we’ve come so far already. We aren’t perfect no and we don’t expect you to be but what we do need is people with Drive and Ambition to get better each time. If this isn’t you, I wish you nothing but the best of luck.
reviews.review_summary: Staffing CNAs, LPNs,RNs, and MDs...who knew?
reviews.review_advice: Keep moving forward. I appreciate the career and I can’t wait to see the result.

reviews.review_pros:
-free parking
-attractive appearance I guess
reviews.review_cons:
-“run to the manager instead of using mature confrontation” culture
-They terminate new nurses for fixable learning issues during a pandemic without a second thought.
-this isn’t a real teaching hospital
-Benefits could be a LOT better
-Pay for new graduate nurses is actually low. I was able to find a new job that pays over $3 more per hour. With better hours and benefits.
-Claims from older, seasoned nurses are automatically believed over the newbie, young nurse
-Poor/lazy residency program. The residency directors did not make their presence evident. I felt unsupported, especially during my termination 
-Preceptors talk down on you in front of patients and other staff
reviews.review_summary: Labor and Delivery leadership is ageist and unfair; I was wrongfully terminated
reviews.review_advice:
-Support the Nurse residents more
-Encourage conflict resolution instead of automatically believing claims. This will prevent false claims and rumors from being acceptable
-If you see a new grad struggling? Try supporting her as opposed to insulting her skills, damaging her confidence, and barring her from the hospital. Maybe also try switching units. 
-Bump up the pay and benefits. Outpatient offices are making you guys look pretty bad.

review_employer_responses.response_text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience – your feedback is important to us as we work to create a supportive environment for all of our employees, including our new nurses. Your advice has been shared internally with human resources and residency leadership; we continually strive to foster innovation, collaboration and employee wellbeing. 

We encourage any employees who believe that a discipline or termination is unfair to go through our Dispute Resolution process. Please reach out to Employee Relations at hrbp-hrsp@aahs.org for more information.

AAMC is committed to helping new graduates transition smoothly to rewarding nursing careers. That includes providing timely feedback and educational support so new nursing graduates can be successful in their roles as we provide the best possible care for their patients and be successful in their roles at AAMC. Our 12-month Vizient/AACN Nurse Residency Program has also consistently demonstrated lower turnover rates when compared to nationwide results. 2020 has been an unusual year for health care, but our commitment to low turnover remains the same.

review_employer_responses.response_text: Thank you for your review.  While AAMC may not be part of a university setting, we are a teaching hospital  that includes graduate medical education, pharmacist, physical therapist and administrative fellowship opportunities.  We are a clinical site for area colleges and universities for nursing and allied health students and we offer OTJ training for employees looking to advance through our Expanding Horizon program.  Our HR  Development team offers many different trainings to all employees which continue through on-line learning during the COVID pandemic.

reviews.review_cons: I feel like I am constantly drowning. The model is always to "do more with less."

reviews.review_pros: Great staff, nice area, opportunity for professional growth and improvement
reviews.review_cons: Administration is changing its focus from community based and staff orientation to a financial focus and growth. They look good on paper as magnet but often don't practice the skills of magnet as they did originally.
reviews.review_summary: Expanding hospital with opportunity for professional growth
reviews.review_advice: Readjust your focus back to the staff who have grown you and your reputation.

reviews.review_pros: I had an awesome work environment in the Bowie Outpatient Rehabilitation Office and now here at Annapolis. In the matter of 8 months I was able to work my way up to a higher position in the company! I now have administrative autonomy and placed again around great co-workers and supervisors who support my professional growth.
reviews.review_cons: Awesome company, but poor leave compensation.
reviews.review_advice: Please continue to work on higher leave amounts for hourly employees.

reviews.review_pros: Incredible team, and amazing work environment where the work you do matters, and helps employees and patients in a positive way.
reviews.review_cons: Steep learning curve makes getting started difficult.

review_employer_responses.response_text: Thank you for your feedback! AAMC is a growing organization that is focused on innovation and providing high quality care at a low cost for its community. With that being said AAMC can be a busy environment. However, your input, ideas and energy will be greatly valued every step of the way!

reviews.review_pros: Great team work, great learning hosptial

reviews.review_pros: great teamwork and excellent nursing staff.
reviews.review_cons: Can't think of anything bad.

reviews.review_pros: Offer nursing scholarships and money for school. Location/ parking.

reviews.review_pros: Very understanding of me having a family; flexible hours; room to grow

review_employer_responses.response_text: Thank you for your comments.  In the past year we have worked to improve  compensation and benefits to include raising the minimum wage to $15/hour and applied market adjustments to a variety of positions to remain competitive in the market place.

reviews.review_pros: Good but expensive benefits.  Pay.
reviews.review_cons: It became about money.  How quickly we could move patients in and out. Not just efficiently, but by X time.
reviews.review_advice: The nurse in us needs to be honored.   We know it has to make a profit, but it’s difficult to be hounded about discharges.

reviews.review_pros: Great People to work with! Very friendly and open
reviews.review_cons: Difficult leadership and strong work culture that is against change

reviews.review_pros: Promotes employee well being and wonderful leadership
reviews.review_cons: Reality, management is not there to aide employees
reviews.review_advice: Practice what you preach

reviews.review_pros: Nice employees, people work hard, close to home, good parking.
reviews.review_cons: No confidence in management and executive leaders. Everyone who has been here a long time will tell you that it used to be a really great place to work, but it's going downhill. Leaders just want to pat themselves on the back and they forget about the people who are actually making things happen.
reviews.review_advice: Stop doing so many things all at once or if you can't do that then hire more people.

review_employer_responses.response_text: We appreciate your feedback.  AAMC  is fortunate to be in a phase of growth with the addition of the McNew  Family Medical Center, Cardiac Surgery and the partnership with Doctor's Community Hospital, to form a new healthcare system in Maryland.  With these changes there will be additional staff to support our growth.    We know our employees are our greatest asset and it takes our employees and leaders to keep us moving forward.

reviews.review_pros: I thoroughly enjoyed my time at this facility.
reviews.review_cons: I can’t think 💭 f any at this time.
